files.title: Overview
files.summary: The fundamental storage unit in the PTX memory model is a byte, consisting of 8 bits. Each state space available to a PTX program is a sequence of contiguous bytes in memory. Every byte in a PTX state space has a unique address relative to all threads that have access to the same state space.

files.title: 8.2.1. Overlap
files.summary: Two memory locations are said to overlap when the starting address of one location is within the range of bytes constituting the other location. files.title: 8.2.2. Aliases
files.summary: Two distinct virtual addresses are said to be aliases if they map to the same memory location.

files.title: 8.2.3. Multimem Addresses
files.summary: A multimem address is a virtual address which points to multiple distinct memory locations across devices.
